articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thirteen workers were killed and 38 were injured on Sunday in the explosion of a nickel smelter furnace owned by Indonesia Tsingshan Stainless Steel (ITSS) on Sulawesi island, the owner of the industrial park where the smelter is located said.
articles.title: Indonesia nickel smelter furnace blast kills 13 workers, wounds 38

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Large swaths of Australia on Sunday sweated through heat wave conditions as authorities warned of a high bushfire risk in many parts of the country's vast Western Australia state.
articles.title: Large parts of Australia endure heat wave, lifting bushfire risk

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said on Sunday that over the previous 24 hours it had detected eight Chinese fighter jets crossing over the median line of the Taiwan Strait, as well as one Chinese balloon.
articles.title: Taiwan says eight Chinese fighter jets crossed strait's median line

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Several cities in the central Chinese province of Henan are facing a winter heating supply crunch after a cold wave swept through a swathe of areas, bringing blizzards and sending temperatures to near historic lows.
articles.title: China's Henan province hit by shortage of winter heating after cold wave

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Ukraine's eastern-rite Catholic church on Saturday said a document endorsed by Pope Francis this week permitting blessings for same-sex couples did not apply to his church and its teachings.
articles.title: Ukrainian Catholic church rejects Vatican document on same-sex marriages

articles.author: Maria Caspani
articles.description: An Alabama woman with a rare congenital anomaly that results in her having two uteri gave birth to healthy twin girls earlier this week.
articles.title: Alabama woman with double uterus gives birth to rare twin girls

articles.author: Gram Slattery
articles.description: Republican presidential contender Nikki Haley has risen in opinion polls in recent months largely on the back of college-educated, affluent, suburban professionals, many of whom have tired of Donald Trump's caustic rhetoric and legal troubles.
articles.title: To beat Trump, Nikki Haley tries to expand coalition, and fast

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German police said on Saturday they were heightening security at Cologne Cathedral following indications of an attack planned for New Year's Eve, a week after the interior minister warned of the rising threat of Islamist violence.
articles.title: Security hiked at Cologne cathedral for Christmas amid attack threat

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Former TV journalist Yekaterina Duntsova was disqualified on Saturday as a candidate for Russia's next presidential election, preventing her from running against Vladimir Putin on a platform of opposition to the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Yekaterina Duntsova barred from running against Putin in election

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A drone launched from Iran struck a chemical tanker in the Indian ocean early on Saturday, the U.S. Department of Defense said.
articles.title: Pentagon says Iranian drone 'attack' hit chemical tanker near India
